result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Karla H-E. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of Karla H-E. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

2:34 PM Defendant Jonatan Escobar Grajales in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Jonatan Escobar Grajales.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson interpreted. Appearance by victim via Zoom. Statement by victim. Arguments by parties.
Ct authorized bench warrant for non-appearance
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Defn qualifies for SPD but no appointment has been made as of yet
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report:  Defn is eligible for SPD services, but has not had an atty appointed yet.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Karla H-E. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of Karla H-E. 
Trial Judge - Br 7 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:00 AM Defendant appeared.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Alexandra Klaric duly sworn & interpreted. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
